In the HTML CM you can use HubL (its actually like the HTML + HubL tab in any CM).
The idea behind, is using CM isolated and with reusability propurses. Using only the fields inside CM instead on the template etc.
there are a few occasions where having the hubl module can help
hubl doesn't work in the HTML CM

really?
I think I used not that long ago :thinking_face:
yeah, I feel there are some situations where we should have the ability to work with pure HubL too

well, in that case I suggest to you add an `{% import %}` on the head of the template.
Save your code as macro inside the pure / partial HTML file and then call the macro where you want to use it
made a screen recording
<https://soapbox.wistia.com/videos/gl67pp1lQl>
<@U2PDTMH53> for that is much more simple you can use the HubL conditional directly in the wrap HTML of the group
`{% if is_listing_view %} {{ html }} {% endif %}`
so to make the wrapper html to work properly you need to use the `{{ html }}` always, but you can set a never true conditional so it won't display, is just that you need to put in the code
<@U2PDTMH53> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U2PDTMH53/FBX7YBW7Q/what_i_need_is_.txt|what i need is:>
it actually worked this time

Sure that works too or simplifying it
` {% if not is_listing_view %}  {{html}} {% endif %} `

Trying not to spam the general channel but alert some more people. We want to know if there are people who would be interested in testing future updates to the chrome extension by installing a beta version of the extension (you would be able to disable the one you donâ€™t want to use, so in the event something is broken in the beta version you can always safely go back to the stable version). Both extensions would continue to get auto updates. The Beta version would update more frequently but would be more likely to contain bugs because - beta. If interested please throw some emotes in the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> channel :slightly_smiling_face:
Is there anyway to export a CMS/Blog/Landing page's html? (Naturally without just doing a view source and copying the whole thing). Basically like a backup of the page/post
we're removing an old post and redirecting to a newer more relevant post but I wanted to make sure I got some backup of it first

<https://spin.d.pr/kJ3zVY+>

This more what you were looking for?
it was more looking at a blog post level not template
like in the performance detail page having an export to html button
something
or like I posted in ideas to have a expiration type functionality in blogs
Can you use the API to loop over blog posts and curl for the html
I didn't think of curl. I'll have to play with that and try it out.
